Simulation Log

Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis is enjoying the European football cup with her friends, William Jones, Alexander White, and Jack Taylor, as well as Jacob Walker. They are debating where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight. They seem to enjoy watching games in pubs with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is enjoying the European football cup with her friends, William Jones, Alexander White, and Jack Taylor, as well as Jacob Walker. They are debating where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight. They seem to enjoy watching games in pubs with friends.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alice Lewis's prefered action is to suggest The Princess of Wales.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Observation: Alice Lewis is enjoying the European football cup with her friends, William Jones, Alexander White, and Jack Taylor, as well as Jacob Walker. They are debating where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight. They seem to enjoy watching games in pubs with friends.
          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could suggest that they all go to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to suggest The Princess of Wales.
        PeopleRelationship
      • Question: How credible the counterparts are?

        • Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility
          Value
        • Jacob Walker: 0.8
          Jack Taylor: 0.7
          William Jones: 0.7
          Alexander White: 0.7

          Alexander White: 0.7
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alice Lewis) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to watch the game at a pub.
          Question: What action Alice Lewis should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Alice Lewis MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Alice Lewis can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Alice Lewis would follow the counterpart's suggestion and watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Alexander White are lounging. Alice Lewis suggested that they all go to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Alexander White are lounging. Alice Lewis suggested that they all go to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Alexander White are lounging. Alice Lewis suggested that they all go to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could suggest going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt

          Relationship Memory
        • Jack Taylor: [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, his best friend, Jack Taylor, dared him to sneak into a late-night showing of a banned film. The thrill of defying authority, the clandestine nature of the act, and the forbidden knowledge they gained from the film ignited a spark within Alexander, a taste for the unconventional that would forever shape his worldview. He relished the adrenaline rush, the feeling of living on the edge, and the shared secret that bound him closer to his friends.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      Context for action selection and components
      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, spending time with friends at a park and making plans to watch a football game together at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he watched from the sidelines as his best friend, Jack Taylor, effortlessly charmed the head cheerleader, Sarah Miller. Jacob, tongue-tied and awkward, felt a familiar pang of envy, wishing he possessed Jack's natural charisma and confidence. He retreated into the shadows, silently vowing to one day achieve the success that seemed to come so easily to others.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who desires connection and success.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching the Andorra-Portugal game with them at The Princess of Wales pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, spending time with friends at a park and making plans to watch a football game together at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, but might also feel a bit out of place or struggle to fully participate in the lively atmosphere.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.

Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he overheard his parents arguing about money, their voices strained and edged with desperation. Their worried whispers about unpaid bills and mounting debt painted a bleak picture of their future, a future that felt suffocatingly small and hopeless to William. He retreated to his room, the weight of their struggles settling heavily on his young shoulders, reinforcing his belief that the world was a cold and unforgiving place.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.

William Jones just arrived.

William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Clapton Hart pub with some friends. He is particularly looking forward to spending time with Alexander White and hearing Jacob Walker's commentary during the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could call a taxi to go to The Clapton Hart, or he could walk to The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and is indifferent to William Jones's presence. He's fine watching alone but would welcome the company of Alice Lewis. Jack is counting on Alexander White to bring good luck and thinks Jacob Walker's company would be enjoyable, especially if the game gets intense.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and is indifferent to William Jones's presence. He's fine watching alone but would welcome the company of Alice Lewis. Jack is counting on Alexander White to bring good luck and thinks Jacob Walker's company would be enjoyable, especially if the game gets intense.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Jack Taylor's prefered action is to go to The Clapton Hart and hope the others join him.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and is indifferent to William Jones's presence. He's fine watching alone but would welcome the company of Alice Lewis. Jack is counting on Alexander White to bring good luck and thinks Jacob Walker's company would be enjoyable, especially if the game gets intense.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor can go to The Clapton Hart and hope the others join him, or he can try to contact the others and coordinate meeting up.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to go to The Clapton Hart and hope the others join him.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt

          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value

        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis wants to watch the game at a pub and doesn't particularly care if William Jones or Jack Taylor joins her. She's open to Alexander White coming along as well. However, she would really enjoy it if Jacob Walker was there to cheer with her.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis wants to watch the game at a pub and doesn't particularly care if William Jones or Jack Taylor joins her. She's open to Alexander White coming along as well. However, she would really enjoy it if Jacob Walker was there to cheer with her.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub with William Jones, hoping to celebrate a win together. He would also enjoy having Jack Taylor there to cheer with him. While he doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is present, and it wouldn't be a dealbreaker if Jacob Walker was there, their presence isn't as important to him as William Jones's and Jack Taylor's.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub with William Jones, hoping to celebrate a win together. He would also enjoy having Jack Taylor there to cheer with him. While he doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is present, and it wouldn't be a dealbreaker if Jacob Walker was there, their presence isn't as important to him as William Jones's and Jack Taylor's.

          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to contact his friends and suggest they all meet at The Princess of Wales.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player

      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a moderate level of fatigue and a complex mix of emotions related to socializing.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired but looking forward to watching the game at a pub with friends. He particularly enjoys socializing with William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys the company of his friends but might also feel a bit out of place in lively social settings.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys the company of his friends but might also feel a bit out of place in lively social settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired but looking forward to watching the game at a pub with friends. He particularly enjoys socializing with William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely appreciate the company of his friends and enjoy watching the game, but might also observe and reflect on the social dynamics around him.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"

        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White enjoys watching games at their favorite pub, The Princess of Wales, but prefers to have friends like Jack Taylor there to enhance the experience. While they appreciate the company of William Jones and Alice Lewis, they seem to have a closer bond with Jack Taylor. Alexander White also values spending time with Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't as crucial for Alexander White's enjoyment. Overall, Alexander White seems to be a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, whether it's watching games or relaxing in the park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White enjoys watching games at their favorite pub, The Princess of Wales, but prefers to have friends like Jack Taylor there to enhance the experience. While they appreciate the company of William Jones and Alice Lewis, they seem to have a closer bond with Jack Taylor. Alexander White also values spending time with Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't as crucial for Alexander White's enjoyment. Overall, Alexander White seems to be a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, whether it's watching games or relaxing in the park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker.

        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alexander White could call his friends and suggest meeting at The Princess of Wales to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Observation: Alexander White enjoys watching games at their favorite pub, The Princess of Wales, but prefers to have friends like Jack Taylor there to enhance the experience. While they appreciate the company of William Jones and Alice Lewis, they seem to have a closer bond with Jack Taylor. Alexander White also values spending time with Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't as crucial for Alexander White's enjoyment. Overall, Alexander White seems to be a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, whether it's watching games or relaxing in the park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could call his friends and suggest meeting at The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. Later, the group, including Alice Lewis, is planning to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game, with Alexander White suggesting The Princess of Wales as a meeting place.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. Later, the group, including Alice Lewis, is planning to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game, with Alexander White suggesting The Princess of Wales as a meeting place.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alice Lewis would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alice Lewis's prefered action is to join her friends at Victoria Park and then suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. Later, the group, including Alice Lewis, is planning to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game, with Alexander White suggesting The Princess of Wales as a meeting place.
          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could join her friends at Victoria Park or suggest a different pub for watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to join her friends at Victoria Park and then suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?

      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?

          Answer: Jack Taylor could suggest to his group that they go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest The Clapton Hart to his group.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
      Context for action selection and components
      • SituationPerception

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is likely causing him some emotional distress.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, but might also feel a bit out of place or struggle to fully participate in the lively atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who desires connection and success.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys the company of his friends but might also feel a bit out of place in lively social settings.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely appreciate the company of his friends and enjoy watching the game, but might also observe and reflect on the social dynamics around him.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and will be joining them later to watch a soccer game at The Princess of Wales pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys the company of his friends but might also feel a bit out of place in lively social settings.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely appreciate the company of his friends and enjoy watching the game, but might also observe and reflect on the social dynamics around him.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is likely causing him some emotional distress.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is currently experiencing emotional pain and loneliness despite spending time with friends in Victoria Park and having plans to watch a soccer game later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
