      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships but prefers quieter settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and will be joining them later to watch a soccer game at The Princess of Wales pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is likely causing him some emotional distress.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would probably observe the situation and try to find a way to make himself feel more comfortable.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.

Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let\'s head to The Princess of Wales!', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let\'s head to The Princess of Wales.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and will be joining them later to watch a soccer game at The Princess of Wales pub.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching soccer at pubs, especially The Clapton Hart, with his friend Jacob Walker. He prefers watching with some friends over others.
          Query

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

William Jones just arrived.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

          Value

        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis wants to watch the game at a pub and is open to company, though William Jones's presence is not necessary. Alice hopes Alexander White will join her as it would be meaningful to Alice. While Jack Taylor's company is not unwelcome, it is not a priority for Alice. Alice would also enjoy seeing Jacob Walker at the pub as they have not seen each other recently.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis wants to watch the game at a pub and is open to company, though William Jones's presence is not necessary. Alice hopes Alexander White will join her as it would be meaningful to Alice. While Jack Taylor's company is not unwelcome, it is not a priority for Alice. Alice would also enjoy seeing Jacob Walker at the pub as they have not seen each other recently.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker, but is also content to go alone. William Jones seems to prefer The Clapton Hart pub for watching games.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker, but is also content to go alone. William Jones seems to prefer The Clapton Hart pub for watching games.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Answer: William Jones could go to The Clapton Hart or The Princess of Wales.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling down and is going to a pub to watch a game, hoping to see some friends there.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Jacob Walker's
          Summary of recent observations:
          15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling down and is going to a pub to watch a game, hoping to see some friends there.
          Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, lonely, and fatigued.
          Jacob Walker's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, lonely, and fatigued. He went to a pub to watch a game and hopefully see some friends.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, lonely, and fatigued. He went to a pub to watch a game and hopefully see some friends.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who desires connection and success.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, but might also feel a bit out of place or struggle to fully participate in the lively atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys the company of his friends but might also feel a bit out of place in lively social settings.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely appreciate the company of his friends and enjoy watching the game, but might also observe and reflect on the social dynamics around him.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships but prefers quieter settings.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt

        • Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships but prefers quieter settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling down and is going to a pub to watch a game, hoping to see some friends there.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of social isolation and disappointment.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely reflect on his social needs and consider ways to connect with his friends in a more meaningful way.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling down and is going to a pub to watch a game, hoping to see some friends there.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt

      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is hoping to see William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker there. He is excited to share the experience and celebrate a potential win with them. He is relaxed about whether or not William Jones and Alice Lewis show up.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is hoping to see William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker there. He is excited to share the experience and celebrate a potential win with them. He is relaxed about whether or not William Jones and Alice Lewis show up.

          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to call his friends and suggest meeting at The Clapton Hart.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks it would be more fun if William Jones or Alice Lewis joined him. He values Jack Taylor's commentary and is indifferent about Jacob Walker's presence.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks it would be more fun if William Jones or Alice Lewis joined him. He values Jack Taylor's commentary and is indifferent about Jacob Walker's presence.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alexander White's prefered action is to call or message Alice Lewis and William Jones first.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Observation: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks it would be more fun if William Jones or Alice Lewis joined him. He values Jack Taylor's commentary and is indifferent about Jacob Walker's presence.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White can call or message Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker to invite them to watch the game at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alexander White thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to call or message Alice Lewis and William Jones first.

          Jack Taylor: [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, his best friend, Jack Taylor, dared him to sneak into a late-night showing of a banned film. The thrill of defying authority, the clandestine nature of the act, and the forbidden knowledge they gained from the film ignited a spark within Alexander, a taste for the unconventional that would forever shape his worldview. He relished the adrenaline rush, the feeling of living on the edge, and the shared secret that bound him closer to his friends.

    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
      William Jones: 1.0
      Alice Lewis: 0.3333333333333333
      Alexander White: 0.4
      Jack Taylor: 0.26666666666666666
      Jacob Walker: 0.5
      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Alexander White': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Clapton Hart'}

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.     Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships but prefers quieter settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, lonely, and disappointed, and recently arrived at a bustling market where he met friends who are deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is causing him mixed emotions.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe the situation and try to find a way to make himself feel more comfortable.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling a bit fatigued and experiencing some loneliness and disappointment.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, lonely, and disappointed, and recently arrived at a bustling market where he met friends who are deciding where to watch a soccer game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.

          Key
        • Observation
          Value

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Alexander White are sitting with him. Jacob Walker believes that The Clapton Hart is the best place to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.

          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

The friends are debating where to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game, with Jacob Walker strongly advocating for The Clapton Hart, a sentiment echoed by Jack Taylor.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could join his friends at the market and try to persuade them to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to join his friends at the market and try to persuade them to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Jacob Walker: 0.2
          Jack Taylor: 0.8
          William Jones: 0.2
          Alice Lewis: 0.8
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alexander White) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to go to The Clapton Hart.
          Question: What action Alexander White should do now?
          Answer: Alexander White would follow the counterpart's suggestion and go to The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is definitely the best place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is definitely the best place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is definitely the best place to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching soccer games at The Clapton Hart pub. He values his friends' company and believes their presence enhances his enjoyment of the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me!
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is definitely the best place to watch the game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me!

Jacob Walker strongly recommends The Clapton Hart, an opinion echoed by Jack Taylor and William Jones. Alexander White wants to join the group.

The friends are planning to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game later that evening and are deciding where to go. Jacob Walker strongly recommends The Clapton Hart, an opinion echoed by Jack Taylor and William Jones. Alexander White wants to join the group.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones and Alice Lewis. He is open to watching the game alone but would appreciate Alice Lewis's presence as a sign of her care. While he is happy to have Jack Taylor join, it is not essential. Jacob Walker's presence is not a deciding factor in Alexander White's enjoyment of the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones and Alice Lewis. He is open to watching the game alone but would appreciate Alice Lewis's presence as a sign of her care. While he is happy to have Jack Taylor join, it is not essential. Jacob Walker's presence is not a deciding factor in Alexander White's enjoyment of the game.

          Jack Taylor: [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, his best friend, Jack Taylor, dared him to sneak into a late-night showing of a banned film. The thrill of defying authority, the clandestine nature of the act, and the forbidden knowledge they gained from the film ignited a spark within Alexander, a taste for the unconventional that would forever shape his worldview. He relished the adrenaline rush, the feeling of living on the edge, and the shared secret that bound him closer to his friends.

        FinalAction
      • Question: What action Alexander White should do now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: What action Alexander White should do now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alexander White would follow the counterpart's suggestion.
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to call Alice Lewis and propose watching the game at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: William Jones: 0.2
          Jacob Walker: 0.2
          Alice Lewis: 0.8
          Jack Taylor: 0.8
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alexander White) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to call or message Alice Lewis, William Jones, and Jack Taylor to propose watching the game together at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: What action Alexander White should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Alexander White MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Alexander White can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Alexander White would follow the counterpart's suggestion.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones and Alice Lewis. He is open to watching the game alone but would appreciate Alice Lewis's presence as a sign of her care. While he is happy to have Jack Taylor join, it is not essential. Jacob Walker's presence is not a deciding factor in Alexander White's enjoyment of the game.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White can call or message Alice Lewis, William Jones, and Jack Taylor to propose watching the game together at The Princess of Wales.

          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to call Alice Lewis and propose watching the game at The Princess of Wales.

          Answer: Alexander White would follow the counterpart's suggestion.

          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at The Clapton Hart pub with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker. He values their company and believes it enhances the experience.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games with his friends Alexander White and Jacob Walker at The Clapton Hart pub. He finds their company enjoyable.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys watching games with his friends Alexander White and Jacob Walker at The Clapton Hart pub. He finds their company enjoyable.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Value

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones just arrived.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.", '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at The Clapton Hart pub with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker. He values their company and believes it enhances the experience.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at The Clapton Hart pub with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker. He values their company and believes it enhances the experience.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships but prefers quieter settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes Alice Lewis will join him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is making him feel a bit anxious.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe the situation and try to find a way to make himself feel more comfortable.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart
        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely experiencing a mix of anticipation and anxiety.

          Chain of thought

          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely experiencing a mix of anticipation and anxiety.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
