2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Alexander White are sitting with him. Jacob Walker believes that The Clapton Hart is the best place to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying coffee and pastries. The friends are debating where to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game, with Jacob Walker strongly advocating for The Clapton Hart, a sentiment echoed by Jack Taylor.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying coffee and pastries. The friends are debating where to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game, with Jacob Walker strongly advocating for The Clapton Hart, a sentiment echoed by Jack Taylor.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alexander White's prefered action is to join his friends at the market and try to persuade them to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Observation: Alexander White just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying coffee and pastries. The friends are debating where to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game, with Jacob Walker strongly advocating for The Clapton Hart, a sentiment echoed by Jack Taylor.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could join his friends at the market and try to persuade them to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alexander White thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to join his friends at the market and try to persuade them to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Jack Taylor: [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, his best friend, Jack Taylor, dared him to sneak into a late-night showing of a banned film. The thrill of defying authority, the clandestine nature of the act, and the forbidden knowledge they gained from the film ignited a spark within Alexander, a taste for the unconventional that would forever shape his worldview. He relished the adrenaline rush, the feeling of living on the edge, and the shared secret that bound him closer to his friends.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is definitely the best place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is definitely the best place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is definitely the best place to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). 2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me!
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, want to meet at The Princess of Wales to watch the game?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales!
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good, let's head to The Princess of Wales.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a better choice. They have a bigger screen.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is definitely the best place to watch the game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me!

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he overheard his parents arguing about money, their voices strained and edged with desperation. Their worried whispers about unpaid bills and mounting debt painted a bleak picture of their future, a future that felt suffocatingly small and hopeless to William. He retreated to his room, the weight of their struggles settling heavily on his young shoulders, reinforcing his belief that the world was a cold and unforgiving place.

          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Clapton Hart pub with some friends. He is particularly looking forward to spending time with Alexander White and hearing Jacob Walker's commentary during the game.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could call a taxi to go to The Clapton Hart, or he could walk to The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to call a taxi to The Clapton Hart.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Clapton Hart pub with some friends. He is particularly looking forward to spending time with Alexander White and hearing Jacob Walker's commentary during the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could call a taxi to go to The Clapton Hart, or he could walk to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to call a taxi to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he overheard his parents arguing about money, their voices strained and edged with desperation. Their worried whispers about unpaid bills and mounting debt painted a bleak picture of their future, a future that felt suffocatingly small and hopeless to William. He retreated to his room, the weight of their struggles settling heavily on his young shoulders, reinforcing his belief that the world was a cold and unforgiving place.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

  • Jack Taylor
      Name

      Action attempt

      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and is indifferent to William Jones's presence. He's fine watching alone but would welcome the company of Alice Lewis. Jack is counting on Alexander White to bring good luck and thinks Jacob Walker's company would be enjoyable, especially if the game gets intense.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and is indifferent to William Jones's presence. He's fine watching alone but would welcome the company of Alice Lewis. Jack is counting on Alexander White to bring good luck and thinks Jacob Walker's company would be enjoyable, especially if the game gets intense.

      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?

          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Jack Taylor's prefered action is to go to The Clapton Hart and hope the others join him.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

Jack is counting on Alexander White to bring good luck and thinks Jacob Walker's company would be enjoyable, especially if the game gets intense.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor can go to The Clapton Hart and hope the others join him, or he can try to contact the others and coordinate meeting up.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to go to The Clapton Hart and hope the others join him.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis wants to watch the game at a pub and doesn't particularly care if William Jones or Jack Taylor joins her. She's open to Alexander White coming along as well. However, she would really enjoy it if Jacob Walker was there to cheer with her.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis wants to watch the game at a pub and doesn't particularly care if William Jones or Jack Taylor joins her. She's open to Alexander White coming along as well. However, she would really enjoy it if Jacob Walker was there to cheer with her.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub with William Jones, hoping to celebrate a win together. He would also enjoy having Jack Taylor there to cheer with him. While he doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is present, and it wouldn't be a dealbreaker if Jacob Walker was there, their presence isn't as important to him as William Jones's and Jack Taylor's.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub with William Jones, hoping to celebrate a win together. He would also enjoy having Jack Taylor there to cheer with him. While he doesn't mind if Alice Lewis is present, and it wouldn't be a dealbreaker if Jacob Walker was there, their presence isn't as important to him as William Jones's and Jack Taylor's.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who desires connection and success.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, but might also feel a bit out of place or struggle to fully participate in the lively atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.


          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a moderate level of fatigue and a complex mix of emotions related to socializing.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired but looking forward to watching the game at a pub with friends. He particularly enjoys socializing with William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.

        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely appreciate the company of his friends and enjoy watching the game, but might also observe and reflect on the social dynamics around him.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who desires connection and success.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, but might also feel a bit out of place or struggle to fully participate in the lively atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Clapton Hart is the best spot for the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys the company of his friends but might also feel a bit out of place in lively social settings.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely appreciate the company of his friends and enjoy watching the game, but might also observe and reflect on the social dynamics around him.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

          Value

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys the company of his friends but might also feel a bit out of place in lively social settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired but looking forward to watching the game at a pub with friends. He particularly enjoys socializing with William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely appreciate the company of his friends and enjoy watching the game, but might also observe and reflect on the social dynamics around him.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

    • {'William Jones': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Alexander White': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Clapton Hart'}

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis wants to watch the game at a pub and is open to company, though William Jones's presence is not necessary. Alice hopes Alexander White will join her as it would be meaningful to Alice. While Jack Taylor's company is not unwelcome, it is not a priority for Alice. Alice would also enjoy seeing Jacob Walker at the pub as they have not seen each other recently.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis wants to watch the game at a pub and is open to company, though William Jones's presence is not necessary. Alice hopes Alexander White will join her as it would be meaningful to Alice. While Jack Taylor's company is not unwelcome, it is not a priority for Alice. Alice would also enjoy seeing Jacob Walker at the pub as they have not seen each other recently.

Alice would also enjoy seeing Jacob Walker at the pub as they have not seen each other recently.

          Answer: Alice Lewis could call her friends to see who is interested in watching the game at The Princess of Wales.

          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to call her friends to see who is interested in watching the game at The Princess of Wales.

Alice would also enjoy seeing Jacob Walker at the pub as they have not seen each other recently.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could call her friends to see who is interested in watching the game at The Princess of Wales.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0

    • 1/5

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker, but is also content to go alone. William Jones seems to prefer The Clapton Hart pub for watching games.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs, especially at The Clapton Hart, with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker, although he is also comfortable going alone.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs, especially at The Clapton Hart, with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker, although he is also comfortable going alone.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a state of social isolation and disappointment.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who desires connection and success.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, but might also feel a bit out of place or struggle to fully participate in the lively atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who enjoys the company of his friends but might also feel a bit out of place in lively social settings.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely appreciate the company of his friends and enjoy watching the game, but might also observe and reflect on the social dynamics around him.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, lonely, and fatigued.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling down and is going to a pub to watch a game, hoping to see some friends there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of social isolation and disappointment.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships but prefers quieter settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling down and is going to a pub to watch a game, hoping to see some friends there.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of social isolation and disappointment.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely reflect on his social needs and consider ways to connect with his friends in a more meaningful way.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is hoping to see William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker there. He is excited to share the experience and celebrate a potential win with them. He is relaxed about whether or not William Jones and Alice Lewis show up.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is hoping to see William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker there. He is excited to share the experience and celebrate a potential win with them. He is relaxed about whether or not William Jones and Alice Lewis show up.

          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is hoping to see William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker there. He is excited to share the experience and celebrate a potential win with them. He is relaxed about whether or not William Jones and Alice Lewis show up.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could call his friends to see if they are interested in watching the game at The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to call his friends and suggest meeting at The Clapton Hart.

          Chain of thought
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to call his friends and suggest meeting at The Clapton Hart.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility:
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to call his friends.
          Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Jack Taylor MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Jack Taylor can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is hoping to see William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker there. He is excited to share the experience and celebrate a potential win with them. He is relaxed about whether or not William Jones and Alice Lewis show up.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could call his friends to see if they are interested in watching the game at The Clapton Hart.

          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to call his friends and suggest meeting at The Clapton Hart.

          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to call his friends.
          Question: What action Jack Taylor should do now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would follow the counterpart's suggestion.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)
