2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks it would be more fun if William Jones or Alice Lewis joined him. He values Jack Taylor's commentary and is indifferent about Jacob Walker's presence.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks it would be more fun if William Jones or Alice Lewis joined him. He values Jack Taylor's commentary and is indifferent about Jacob Walker's presence.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alexander White's prefered action is to call or message Alice Lewis and William Jones first.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Observation: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and thinks it would be more fun if William Jones or Alice Lewis joined him. He values Jack Taylor's commentary and is indifferent about Jacob Walker's presence.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White can call or message Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker to invite them to watch the game at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alexander White thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to call or message Alice Lewis and William Jones first.

      • Question: How credible the counterparts are?

          Jack Taylor: [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, his best friend, Jack Taylor, dared him to sneak into a late-night showing of a banned film. The thrill of defying authority, the clandestine nature of the act, and the forbidden knowledge they gained from the film ignited a spark within Alexander, a taste for the unconventional that would forever shape his worldview. He relished the adrenaline rush, the feeling of living on the edge, and the shared secret that bound him closer to his friends.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
      William Jones: 1.0
      Alice Lewis: 0.3333333333333333
      Alexander White: 0.4
      Jack Taylor: 0.26666666666666666
      Jacob Walker: 0.5
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones and Alice Lewis. He is open to watching the game alone but would appreciate Alice Lewis's presence as a sign of her care. While he is happy to have Jack Taylor join, it is not essential. Jacob Walker's presence is not a deciding factor in Alexander White's enjoyment of the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones and Alice Lewis. He is open to watching the game alone but would appreciate Alice Lewis's presence as a sign of her care. While he is happy to have Jack Taylor join, it is not essential. Jacob Walker's presence is not a deciding factor in Alexander White's enjoyment of the game.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alexander White's prefered action is to call Alice Lewis and propose watching the game at The Princess of Wales.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Observation: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones and Alice Lewis. He is open to watching the game alone but would appreciate Alice Lewis's presence as a sign of her care. While he is happy to have Jack Taylor join, it is not essential. Jacob Walker's presence is not a deciding factor in Alexander White's enjoyment of the game.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White can call or message Alice Lewis, William Jones, and Jack Taylor to propose watching the game together at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alexander White thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to call Alice Lewis and propose watching the game at The Princess of Wales.

He relished the adrenaline rush, the feeling of living on the edge, and the shared secret that bound him closer to his friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
        FinalAction
      • Question: What action Alexander White should do now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: What action Alexander White should do now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Alexander White would follow the counterpart's suggestion.
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Alexander White would prefered now?
          Answer: Alexander White's prefered action is to call Alice Lewis and propose watching the game at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: William Jones: 0.2
          Jacob Walker: 0.2
          Alice Lewis: 0.8
          Jack Taylor: 0.8
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Alexander White) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to call or message Alice Lewis, William Jones, and Jack Taylor to propose watching the game together at The Princess of Wales.
          Question: What action Alexander White should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Alexander White MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Alexander White can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Alexander White would follow the counterpart's suggestion.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White wants to watch the game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones and Alice Lewis. He is open to watching the game alone but would appreciate Alice Lewis's presence as a sign of her care. While he is happy to have Jack Taylor join, it is not essential. Jacob Walker's presence is not a deciding factor in Alexander White's enjoyment of the game.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player

      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.

        • Statements:
          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at The Clapton Hart pub with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker. He values their company and believes it enhances the experience.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games with his friends Alexander White and Jacob Walker at The Clapton Hart pub. He finds their company enjoyable.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys watching games with his friends Alexander White and Jacob Walker at The Clapton Hart pub. He finds their company enjoyable.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:

          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, mind if I join you?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place worth watching the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, Jacob mentioned The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me!
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at The Clapton Hart pub with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker. He values their company and believes it enhances the experience.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is definitely the best place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Clapton Hart or The Princess of Wales.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. You lot are soft.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who values his friendships but prefers quieter settings.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is making him feel a bit anxious.

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe the situation and try to find a way to make himself feel more comfortable.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones will be there to bring good luck. She would also enjoy the company of Alexander White, especially if the game gets intense. Alice is neutral about Jack Taylor's presence and really wants to share the experience with Jacob Walker.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones will be there to bring good luck. She would also enjoy the company of Alexander White, especially if the game gets intense. Alice is neutral about Jack Taylor's presence and really wants to share the experience with Jacob Walker.

        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

She would also enjoy the company of Alexander White, especially if the game gets intense. Alice is neutral about Jack Taylor's presence and really wants to share the experience with Jacob Walker.
          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?

          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's prefered action is to call her friends and suggest meeting at The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What action Alice Lewis should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Alice Lewis MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Alice Lewis can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Alice Lewis would follow her own suggestion and call her friends to suggest meeting at The Princess of Wales.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor wants to go to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see William Jones there. He is neutral about seeing Alice Lewis and Alexander White at the pub. Jack Taylor thinks the game would be a good opportunity to bond with Jacob Walker.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor wants to go to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see William Jones there. He is neutral about seeing Alice Lewis and Alexander White at the pub. Jack Taylor thinks the game would be a good opportunity to bond with Jacob Walker.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
        Answer
          Key
        • Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Jack Taylor would prefered now?
          Answer
          Value
        • Jack Taylor's prefered action is to call or message his friends to see if they are interested in going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Observation: Jack Taylor wants to go to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see William Jones there. He is neutral about seeing Alice Lewis and Alexander White at the pub. Jack Taylor thinks the game would be a good opportunity to bond with Jacob Walker.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could call or message his friends to see if they are interested in going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options has the highest likelihood of causing Jack Taylor to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Jack Taylor thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Jack Taylor's prefered action is to call or message his friends to see if they are interested in going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

    • 0

    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
